channel.title: M2V-MX - Review
channel.description:
M2V-MX - Review
The Asus M2V-MX Mother board is a high price($130.44 NZD), low performing board from Asus.
This board has problems running any other Operating System than Windows XP. Although, it does run others, they do not run 100% correctly.
CPU: This motherboard supports AMD 64 Cpus, up to dual core. I am not sure about quad core. It has a standard 200MHZ FSB. Do not try to set this over 225 or your computer will begin to crash.
On board graphics: It comes with a S3 VIA 128/512 MB on board graphics chipset. This has not got much umph. After about an hour, I got pissed off and installed a new card.
Memory: It runs on DDR II 667/800 MHZ ram. I overclocked to 900MHZ Although the box/website states that this motherboard supports Dual Channel ram, it does not work correctly.
Hard disks: This Motherboard supports up to 4 IDE and 8 SATA II hard disks on it's built in chipset. It also supports RAID with it's built in controller. I have not yet tested it's SATA capabilities, but the IDE works a charm.
Overall: This motherboard is not really too powerful. With only one PCI-E X16 Slot and 3 PCI slots, it does not have much room for expansion. However, when you get an operating system running on this, it runs a lot faster than most computers with 3x the specifications. Do not even waste your time trying to install Mac OS X as this will just get the Waiting on Root device error or it will reboot every time it loads into the Flash memory.
This motherboard scores a retarded 4.8/10
Post your comments.

item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

But since the motherboard never stated “Can run Mac OSX” (since it would be illegal, and macs don’t implement the standard bios) you can’t really call it the motherboards fault, if it is anyone’s fault in is Apple’s.

Read full topic

item.title: M2V-MX - Review
item.dc:creator: @runescape3dude runescape3dude
item.description:
@runescape3dude wrote:

Moparisthebest:

There are, but you still haven’t said how not being able to run Mac OSX has anything to do with the motherboard.

I did.

Known Issues

* My system reboots right after EFI is initialized

Some computers are just not able to run Leopard properly, this is mainly due to incompatibilities between the BIOS and Leopards ACPI platform. You can try a different BIOS revision, maybe you find one that works. Some people have success booting with cpus=1 bootflag at Darwin.

* I am stuck at waiting for root device…

Your SATA and/or IDE chipset is most likely not currently supported in Leopard.

Read full topic

item.title: M2V-MX - Review
item.dc:creator: @runescape3dude runescape3dude
item.description:
@runescape3dude wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:10, topic:234613”][quote author=runescape3dude link=topic=309339.msg2471551#msg2471551 date=1223018311]
Do not even waste your time trying to install Mac OS X as this will just get the Waiting on Root device error or it will reboot every time it loads into the Flash memory.
[/quote]

How is that even remotely the fault of the motherboard? It was never meant to run on anything but a Mac, which only uses Intel Core2Duos, and not AMD chips at all (this is a big deal, they have different extensions).

Try installing Operating Systems that are supposed to run on your computer.[/quote]
There are AMD patches. Google it.

Read full topic

item.title: M2V-MX - Review
item.dc:creator: @runescape3dude runescape3dude
item.description:
@runescape3dude wrote:

M2V-MX - Review

The Asus M2V-MX Mother board is a high price($130.44 NZD), low performing board from Asus.

This board has problems running any other Operating System than Windows XP. Although, it does run others, they do not run 100% correctly.

CPU:
This motherboard supports AMD 64 Cpus, up to dual core. I am not sure about quad core.
It has a standard 200MHZ FSB. Do not try to set this over 225 or your computer will begin to crash.

On board graphics:
It comes with a S3 VIA 128/512 MB on board graphics chipset. This has not got much umph.
After about an hour, I got pissed off and installed a new card.

Memory:
It runs on DDR II 667/800 MHZ ram. I overclocked to 900MHZ
Although the box/website states that this motherboard supports Dual Channel ram, it does not work correctly.

Hard disks:
This Motherboard supports up to 4 IDE and 8 SATA II hard disks on it’s built in chipset.
It also supports RAID with it’s built in controller.
I have not yet tested it’s SATA capabilities, but the IDE works a charm.

Overall:
This motherboard is not really too powerful. With only one PCI-E X16 Slot and 3 PCI slots, it does not have much room for expansion. However, when you get an operating system running on this, it runs a lot faster than most computers with 3x the specifications.
Do not even waste your time trying to install Mac OS X as this will just get the Waiting on Root device error or it will reboot every time it loads into the Flash memory.

This motherboard scores a retarded 4.8/10
